intro: Dalea elongata, commonly known as the longpod milkvetch, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Dalea elongata plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
